benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Trigger a payment for all unpaid invoices

covered: Valid Payload scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07) covering successful creation and varying parameters
Invalid Payload and Validation scenarios (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16) covering input validation and error handling
Authorization and Authentication scenarios (TC10, TC17) covering missing/invalid headers and unauthorized access
System/Dependency error handling (TC18, TC19, TC27) covering gateway/database/plugin failures
Security scenarios (TC20, TC21) covering SQL injection and XSS concerns
Edge cases (TC23, TC24, TC25, TC26) including large payloads, large pluginProperty arrays, extra params, and mixed DB states
Recovery and resilience (TC22, TC28, TC29) including transient errors, retry behavior, and backward compatibility
Performance-related scenarios (TC30, TC31, TC32) covering response time and resource utilization under load
Accessibility and documentation (TC33) ensuring API docs are accessible
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling when listing or processing large sets of invoices or results
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related caching behavior
Rate Limiting: No tests explicitly verify how the API handles burst or rate-limited requests
No explicit test for duplicate submissions under certain edge timing scenarios beyond TC28
recommendations: Add tests for pagination behavior and large result sets to ensure proper paging if applicable to invoice data sets.
Include tests asserting caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and cache invalidation behavior for this endpoint.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling under burst conditions and to validate idempotency where applicable.
Consider adding a dedicated duplicate-submission scenario under timing stress to reinforce TC28 coverage.
